\\/D:\\/repos\\/stride-translations\\/pt: <g1>Constraints<\/g1> restrict rigidbodies to certain movement patterns.
<g1>Constraints<\/g1> restringem os corpos rígidos a certos padrões de movimento.
<g1>Constraints<\/g1> restrict rigidbodies to certain movement patterns.
For example, a realistic knee joint can only move along one axis and can't bend forwards.
Por exemplo, uma articulação de joelho realista só pode se mover ao longo de um eixo e não pode dobrar para a frente.
For example, a realistic knee joint can only move along one axis and can't bend forwards.
Constraints can either link two rigidbodies together, or link a single rigidbody to a point in the world.
As restrições podem ligar dois corpos rígidos juntos, ou ligar um único corpo rígido a um ponto no mundo.
Constraints can either link two rigidbodies together, or link a single rigidbody to a point in the world.
They allow for interaction and dependency among rigidbodies.
Eles permitem a interação e dependência entre os corpos rígidos.
They allow for interaction and dependency among rigidbodies.
point to point (fixed distance between two colliders)
ponto a ponto (a distância fixa entre dois colisões)
point to point (fixed distance between two colliders)
For a demonstration of the different constraints, load the <g1>PhysicsSample<\/g1> sample project.
Para uma demonstração das diferentes restrições, carregue o projeto de amostra <g1>PhysicsSample<\/g1>.
For a demonstration of the different constraints, load the <g1>PhysicsSample<\/g1> sample project.
Currently, you can only use constraints from scripts.
Atualmente, você só pode usar restrições de scripts.
Currently, you can only use constraints from scripts.
To create a constraint, use the <g1>Simulation<\/g1> static method <g2>CreateConstraint<\/g2>:
Para criar uma restrição, use o método estático <g1>Simulation<\/g1> <g2>CreateConstraint<\/g2>:
To create a constraint, use the <g1>Simulation<\/g1> static method <g2>CreateConstraint<\/g2>:
CreateConstraint(ConstraintTypes type, RigidbodyComponent rigidBodyA, Matrix frameA, bool useReferenceFrameA);
CriarConstraint(Constraint) Tipos tipo, RigidbodyComponente rígido BodyA, Matrix frameA, uso de boolReferenceFrameA);
CreateConstraint(ConstraintTypes type, RigidbodyComponent rigidBodyA, Matrix frameA, bool useReferenceFrameA);
This links <g1>RigidBodyA<\/g1> to the world at its current location.
Isso liga <g1>RigidBodyA<\/g1> ao mundo em sua localização atual.
This links <g1>RigidBodyA<\/g1> to the world at its current location.
The boolean <g2>useReferenceFrameA<\/g2> specifies which coordinate system the limit is applied to (either <g3>RigidBodyA<\/g3> or the world).
O booleano <g2>useReferenceFrameA<\/g2> especifica qual sistema de coordenadas o limite é aplicado (quer <g3>RigidBodyA<\/g3> ou o mundo).
The boolean <g2>useReferenceFrameA<\/g2> specifies which coordinate system the limit is applied to (either <g3>RigidBodyA<\/g3> or the world).
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.Point2Point<\/g1>, the frame represents a pivot in A.
No caso de <g1>ConstraintTypes.Point2Point<\/g1>, o quadro representa um pivô em A.
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.Point2Point<\/g1>, the frame represents a pivot in A.
Only the translation vector is considered.
Apenas o vetor de tradução é considerado.
Only the translation vector is considered.
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.Hinge<\/g1>, the frame represents a pivot in A and Axis in A.
No caso de <g1>ConstraintTypes.Hinge<\/g1>, o quadro representa um pivô em A e Eixo em A.
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.Hinge<\/g1>, the frame represents a pivot in A and Axis in A.
This is because the hinge allows only a limited angle of rotation between the rigidbody and the world.
Isso porque a dobradiça permite apenas um ângulo limitado de rotação entre o corpo rígido e o mundo.
This is because the hinge allows only a limited angle of rotation between the rigidbody and the world.
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.ConeTwist<\/g1>, <g2>useReferenceFrameA<\/g2> is ignored.
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.ConeTwist<\/g1>, <g2>useReferenceFrameA<\/g2> is ignored.
<g1>ConstraintTypes.Gear<\/g1> needs two rigidbodies to be created.
<g1>ConstraintTypes.Gear<\/g1> precisa de dois corpos rígidos a serem criados.
<g1>ConstraintTypes.Gear<\/g1> needs two rigidbodies to be created.
This function will throw an exception.
Esta função irá lançar uma exceção.
This function will throw an exception.
CreateConstraint(ConstraintTypes type, RigidbodyComponent rigidBodyA, RigidbodyComponent rigidBodyB, Matrix frameA, Matrix frameB, bool useReferenceFrameA)
CriarConstraint(Constraint) Tipos tipo, RigidbodyComponent rigidBodyA, RigidbodyComponent rigidBodyB, Matrix frameA, Matrix frameB, uso de boolReferenceFrameA)
CreateConstraint(ConstraintTypes type, RigidbodyComponent rigidBodyA, RigidbodyComponent rigidBodyB, Matrix frameA, Matrix frameB, bool useReferenceFrameA)
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.Point2Point<\/g1>, the frame represents a pivot in A or B.
No caso de <g1>ConstraintTypes.Point2Point<\/g1>, o quadro representa um pivô em A ou B.
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.Point2Point<\/g1>, the frame represents a pivot in A or B.
Only the translation vector is considered.
Apenas o vetor de tradução é considerado.
Only the translation vector is considered.
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.Hinge<\/g1> the frame represents pivot in A\/B and Axis in A\/B.
No caso de <g1>ConstraintTypes.Hinge<\/g1> o quadro representa pivô em A\/B e Eixo em A\/B.
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.Hinge<\/g1> the frame represents pivot in A\/B and Axis in A\/B.
This is because the hinge allows only a limited angle of rotation between the rigidbody and the world in this case.
Isto porque a dobradiça permite apenas um ângulo limitado de rotação entre o corpo rígido e o mundo neste caso.
This is because the hinge allows only a limited angle of rotation between the rigidbody and the world in this case.
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.ConeTwist<\/g1>, <g2>useReferenceFrameA<\/g2> is ignored.
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.ConeTwist<\/g1>, <g2>useReferenceFrameA<\/g2> is ignored.
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.Gear<\/g1>, <g2>useReferenceFrameA<\/g2> is ignored.
In the case of <g1>ConstraintTypes.Gear<\/g1>, <g2>useReferenceFrameA<\/g2> is ignored.
The frame just represents the axis either in A or B; only the translation vector (which should contain the axis) is used.
O quadro representa apenas o eixo em A ou B; somente o vetor de tradução (que deve conter o eixo) é usado.
The frame just represents the axis either in A or B; only the translation vector (which should contain the axis) is used.
The boolean <g1>useReferenceFrameA<\/g1> determines which coordinate system (<g2>RigidBodyA<\/g2> or <g3>RigidBodyB<\/g3>) the limits are applied to.
O booleano <g1>useReferenceFrameA<\/g1> determina qual sistema de coordenadas (<g2>RigidBodyA<\/g2> ou <g3>RigidBodyB<\/g3>) os limites são aplicados.
The boolean <g1>useReferenceFrameA<\/g1> determines which coordinate system (<g2>RigidBodyA<\/g2> or <g3>RigidBodyB<\/g3>) the limits are applied to.
